definition: to submit to the law/to obey the law

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Suggested Use Take one teaspoon one to three times daily or as directed by your healthcare practitioner.
sentences.chinese: 服法以一茶匙每日一至三次，或由您的保健医生指示。

sentences.english: Follow the directions on the medicine bottle.
sentences.chinese: 请按药瓶上的服法说明服药。

sentences.english: Their easyavailabiltyavailability is part of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他们简单的服法是这个问题的一部分。

sentences.english: Suggested Use Wet hands thoroughly with product and allow to dry without wiping.
sentences.chinese: 服法产品和彻底晾干湿手没有擦。

sentences.english: It says on the bottle to take a spoonful every four hours.
sentences.chinese: 瓶子上的服法指示每四小时服用一匙。

sentences.english: Use 1-day or 3-day regimen if compliance is an issue.
sentences.chinese: 若用药出现身体不适应用一日或三日服法。

sentences.english: The placebo group is the same.
sentences.chinese: 安慰剂组服法同治疗组。

definition: to take medicine orally (as opposed to applying externally)
to mash/to beat to a pulp
to blend two or more medicines/compatibility (of herbal remedies, medicines)
to dry over a fire/to roast
